trans-unit.source: Represents a length measurement.
The Unit structure represents a length measurement that can be expressed in any HTML-compatible size unit.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType> enumeration lists the units of measurement that can be represented.
The Unit is used by properties such as `BorderWidth` and `Height` to represent the length or width of the property.
For example, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A> property of a Web Server control to a Unit that represents five pixels.
> [!NOTE] > The Unit class can represent values only between -32768 and 32767.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A> property to determine the length of the measurement.
The unit of measurement is determined using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A> property.

You can convert other data types to a Unit by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Parse%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Percentage%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Pixel%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Point%2A> methods.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of Unit, see the Unit constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> structure with the specified double precision floating point number.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> structure using the specified double precision floating point number.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A>|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A>|The value specified by `value`.| > [!CAUTION] > If `value` is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.
A double precision floating point number that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> in pixels.
value is not between -32768 and 32767.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> structure with the specified 32-bit signed integer.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> structure using the specified 32-bit signed integer.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A>|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A>|The value specified by `value`.| > [!CAUTION] > If `value` is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.
A 32-bit signed integer that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> in pixels.
value is not between -32768 and 32767.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> structure with the specified length.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> structure using the specified length.
The length is specified in two parts, the length's value and the length's unit type.
For example, "200Cm" represents a length of 200 centimeters.
You can use any valid CSS-compliant unit expression.
The following table lists the common unit types.
|Unit type|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |`Pixel`|Length in pixels.| |`Point`|Length in points.

A point represents 1/72 of an inch.| |`Inch`|Length in inches.| |`Mm`|Length in millimeters.| |`Cm`|Length in centimeters.| |`Percentage`|Length as a percentage of the parent element.| The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A>|The unit type specified in `value`.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A>|The value specified in `value`.| > [!CAUTION] > If `value` is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.
A string that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
The specified length is not between -32768 and 32767.
value is not a valid CSS-compliant unit expression.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> structure with the specified double precision floating point number and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref>.

Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> structure using the specified double precision floating point number and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A>|The value of `type`.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A>|The value specified by `value`.| > [!CAUTION] > If `value` is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.
A double precision floating point number that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref> enumeration values.
value is not between -32768 and 32767.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> structure with the specified length and <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?displayProperty=fullName>.

Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> structure using the specified length and <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?displayProperty=fullName>.
The length is specified in two parts, the length's value and the length's unit type.
For example, "200Cm" represents a length of 200 centimeters.
You can use any valid CSS-compliant unit expression.
The following table lists the common unit types.
|Unit type|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |`Pixel`|Length in pixels.| |`Point`|Length in points.

A point represents 1/72 of an inch.| |`Inch`|Length in inches.| |`Mm`|Length in millimeters.| |`Cm`|Length in centimeters.| |`Percentage`|Length as a percentage of the parent element.| The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A>|The unit type specified in `value`.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A>|The value specified in `value`.| > [!CAUTION] > If `value` is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.
A string that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?displayProperty=fullName> that represents the culture.
The specified length is not between -32768 and 32767.
value is not a valid CSS-compliant unit expression.
Represents an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
This field is read-only.
To be added.
Compares this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> with the specified object.
Use the Equals method to compare the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> that this method is called from with the object specified by `obj`.
For both objects to be equal, they must have the same values for both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A> properties.
> [!NOTE] > The object specified by `obj` must by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> type object for the comparison to succeed.
If the object is `null`, `false` is returned.
The object for comparison.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> that this method is called from is equal to the specified object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> is empty.
Use the IsEmpty property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> is empty.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> is empty if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A> property contains an enumeration value of 0.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> is empty; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> objects to determine whether they are equal.
Use this operator to compare two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> objects for equality.
For both objects to be equal, they must have the same values for both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A> properties.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> on the left side of the operator.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> on the right side of the operator.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if both <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
Compares two <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> objects to determine whether they are not equal.
Use this operator to compare two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> objects for inequality.
For the objects to not be equal, they must have different values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A> property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> on the left side of the operator.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> on the right side of the operator.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> objects are not equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Converts the specified string to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
Use the Parse static method to convert the string specified by the `s` parameter to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit>.
> [!NOTE] > The unit of measurement when using this method is <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>.
The string to convert.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> that represents the specified string.
Converts the specified string and <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?displayProperty=fullName> to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Parse%2A> static method to convert the string specified by `s` to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> in the culture specified by `culture`.
> [!NOTE] > The unit of measurement when using this method is <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>.
The string to convert.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?displayProperty=fullName> object that represents the culture.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> that represents the specified string.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref> from the specified double-precision floating-point number.
Use the Percentage static method to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> of type <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType> that represents the length specified by the `n` parameter.
For example, if you specify 80 for *n* and use the returned unit to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Height%2A> of a Web server control, the `height` attribute is set to 80%.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> class can represent values only between -32768 and 32767.
A double-precision floating-point number that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref> that represents the length specified by the double-precision floating-point number.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref> from the specified 32-bit signed integer.
Use the Pixel static method to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> of type <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType> that represents the length specified by the `n` parameter.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> class can represent values only between -32768 and 32767.
A 32-bit signed integer that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
A of type that represents the length specified by the n parameter.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref> from the specified 32-bit signed integer.
Use the Point static method to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> of type <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType> that represents the length specified by the `n` parameter.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> class can represent values only between -32768 and 32767.
A 32-bit signed integer that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref> that represents the length specified by the 32-bit signed integer.
Converts a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> to a <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> that represents this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
Converts a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> to a string equivalent in the specified culture.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.ToString%2A> method to convert the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> that this method is called from to a string equivalent in the specified culture.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?displayProperty=fullName> that represents the culture.
A <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> represents this in the culture specified by culture.
Converts a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> to a string equivalent using the specified format provider.

The ToString method returns a string representation formatted with a unit <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A> and an abbreviation representing the unit <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type%2A>.
The following table lists <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType> values and their corresponding abbreviation.

|Unit type|Abbreviation| |---------------|------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|px| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|pt| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|pc| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|in| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|mm| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|cm| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|%| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|em| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType>|ex| Use `formatProvider` to specify culture-specific information used to format the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Value%2A>.
If `formatProvider` is `null`, the numeric portion of the string is formatted using a default <xref:System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo> object set for the current culture.
An <xref:System.IFormatProvider> interface implementation that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
A <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> representing this in the format specified by formatProvider.
Gets the unit type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
Use the Type property to determine the unit of measurement that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit> represents, such as pixels.
The Type property is represented by one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType> enumeration values.
> [!NOTE] > If <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.IsEmpty%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType> enumeration value is returned.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref> enumeration values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType"></xref>.
Gets the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
Use the Value property to determine the length of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit>.
A double-precision floating point number that represents the length of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref>.
